decks.notes: The deck focuses on a strategic and disruptive playstyle, utilizing powerful control spells like Force of Will, Mental Misstep, and Force of Negation to counter and remove threats from the opponent. Additionally, it includes cards like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Dig Through Time for card advantage and selection. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds extra value by allowing the player to recur permanents from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through counter magic, removal, and card advantage until it can establish a winning board state.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Shambling Shell, in order to trigger the powerful Dredge mechanic. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to dig through your deck and discard cards, you can quickly amass a board of creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam. With the ability to counter opponent's spells with cards like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap, this deck is designed to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and relentless combo strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach to quickly and efficiently disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation for protection, and stocking up the graveyard with spells like Brain Freeze and Thundering Falls, the deck aims to generate a game-winning turn by casting key spells from the graveyard repeatedly. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable companion, providing additional recursion and value throughout the game. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and resilient, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient combo potential.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of control elements, card advantage, and disruption to out-value and out-maneuver opponents. It aims to control the game through countermagic, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion ensures consistent access to recurring threats and value. The deck also utilizes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt opponents' mana bases and keep them off balance.

The focus of this deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and resource denial. The deck includes powerful cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Ancestral Recall to help maintain control of the game. In addition, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion options to outlast opponents in longer games. Overall, this deck excels at disrupting opponents' plans and maintaining a strong board presence to secure victory.

The deck is focused on utilizing powerful artifacts and lands to disrupt opponents while deploying threats quickly to pressure them. Key components include resource denial with cards like Wasteland and Sphere of Resistance, mana acceleration with Mishra's Workshop and Sol Ring, and disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Null Rod. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early aggression and lock them out of the game with continuous disruption. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim serves as a versatile threat while cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge provide additional utility and card advantage.

The deck is focused on playing disruptive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent while still maintaining a fast and aggressive strategy. It also includes hate cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options while quickly building up its own board presence to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes powerful mana acceleration like Sol Ring and the Moxen to help ramp up its plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana acceleration and disruptive cards like Null Rod to ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures and lock down opponents' strategies. It aims to quickly establish a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells and aggressive creatures. The deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient mana base and powerful threats, making it a formidable force in the early stages of the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan and controlling the board with a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive permanents. It also utilizes card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a powerful companion that provides additional recursion and value throughout the game. Overall, the deck is designed to outlast the opponent and secure a victory through superior card advantage and control of the battlefield.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies while utilizing MUD (Metalworker, Urza's Destiny) archetype cards like Mishra's Workshop and Null Rod to disrupt opponents. The key idea is to deploy threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Stonecoil Serpent quickly while also hindering opponent's game plan with disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void. The deck also has a strong mana acceleration package with cards like Ancient Tomb and Moxen to power out threats ahead of schedule. Finally, Crucible of Worlds and Ghost Quarter combo is used for land disruption and control.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively fill up the graveyard with cards like Blazing Rootwalla, Hollow One, and Master of Death in order to bring back powerful creatures like Vengevine from the graveyard. The deck also includes a variety of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect its game plan, as well as cards like Noxious Revival to recycle key cards. With the ability to quickly generate card advantage and pressure the opponent, this deck aims to overwhelm its opponent before they can establish a solid defense.

The deck aims to create a powerful combo using Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana, while utilizing artifacts and abilities such as Grim Monolith, Mishra's Workshop, and Mana Crypt for additional acceleration. The deck also includes control elements such as Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Key cards like Time Vault and Tinker provide a win condition, while cards like Mana Vault and Coveted Jewel help ramp up to these game-ending plays. The deck's synergy with artifacts and mana acceleration allows for explosive and efficient plays to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. It aims to control the game and out-value the opponent by utilizing powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable card advantage engine, allowing you to recur resources and apply constant pressure. The deck is well-rounded with a mix of card draw, disruption, and mana acceleration to keep you ahead of the opponent and secure the win in a 1 vs 1 Vintage matchup.

The deck focuses on utilizing various fast mana artifacts and spells to accumulate a large amount of mana quickly, then casting powerful spells or using powerful abilities to create a storm of spells that overwhelm the opponent in a single turn. The key strategy involves using cards like Dark Ritual, Tendrils of Agony, and Tendrils of Agony to generate a lethal storm count, while also using cards like Tinker and Demonic Tutor to find combo pieces such as Time Vault and Bolas's Citadel to win the game in a single explosive turn.
